date: stated on October 13, 2014 in a debate:
title: Mitch McConnell says raising the minimum wage will destroy 500 million to 1 million jobs.
text: In the first and only debate in the United States Senate race in Kentucky, questions were raised about his opposition to raising the proposed minimum wage. In response, McConnell, leader of the Republican minority in the Senate, said that raising the minimum wage in already difficult economic times would be detrimental to employment. He quoted the Congressional Budget Office study that allegedly raised the minimum wage to $10.10 per hour would "destruct half a million to a million jobs." "This is not how we grow our economy." His democratic competitor, Minister for Foreign Affairs of Kentucky Allison Lundergan Grimes, replied that the report also indicated that raising the minimum wage would raise "more than a million Americans from poverty."
